DOCNAME: CASE OF TOMINA AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Protection of property (Article 1 para. 1 of Protocol No. 1 - Peaceful enjoyment of possessions)
JUDGES: Branko Lubarda;Dmitry Dedov;Georgios A. Serghides;Helen Keller;Helena Jäderblom;Luis López Guerra;Pere Pastor Vilanova
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are NORP nationals . They owned rooms in a dormitory building in the municipality of PERSON . The municipality reclaimed the building , and the ORG title to the real property in question was annulled as a result of civil proceedings brought against them by a prosecutor on behalf of the municipality . According to the Government , the judgment has not been enforced and the applicants continue to reside in the rooms they had bought .
CARDINAL . PERSON and Mr PERSON ( application no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) submitted that they had never moved into the rooms as they were occupied by other individuals .

CARDINAL . In DATE a ORG - owned enterprise called ORG was privatised and reorganised into a joint - stock limited liability company called ORG . The privatisation plan was approved by the municipality and ORG signed the plan on its behalf . In accordance with the privatisation plan , all residential buildings previously listed on ORG ’s balance sheet were to be transferred to the municipality , while the administrative buildings were to be taken over by PERSON . The privatisation plan referred to a building located at no . CARDINAL PERSON , PERSON , as an administrative building ( used for non - residential purposes ) , and it was transferred to PERSON .

CARDINAL . As a result of a number of reorganisations of ORG , the title to the building in question was transferred to the closed joint - stock company , ORG , separate rooms in the building were resold to third parties , including the applicants . The information concerning the applicants’ titles to the property can be found in the appendix below . According to the title deeds , the applicants were owners of non - residential LOC .
CARDINAL . The applicants moved into the rooms and resided there .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found the NORP privatisation plan and the agreement of CARDINAL DATE – which ORG and PERSON had entered into , and which partly concerned the transfer of the title to the building to Stroitel – null and void .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the Promyshlenniy district prosecutor , acting in the interests of the municipality , brought an action against ORG , ORG and the owners of the rooms in the former dormitory building , including the applicants . Referring to the invalidation of the privatisation of NORP , the prosecutor submitted that the subsequent transactions relating to the building were also null and void , and asked the court to return the title to the building to the municipality .

CARDINAL . According to the applicants , on DATE ORG of Samara ( “ the ORG ” ) dismissed the prosecutor ’s claim . On DATE ORG ( “ the ORG ” ) quashed that judgment and remitted the matter to ORG for fresh consideration .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the prosecutor ’s claim . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE on appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Presidium of ORG quashed the judgments of DATE and DATE by way of supervisory review , and remitted the matter to ORG for fresh consideration . The ORG noted that the lower courts had erroneously applied substantive and procedural laws when deciding the matter .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG allowed the prosecutor ’s claim in full . The court recognised that the owners of the rooms were bona fide purchasers , but ordered that the title to the building be transferred to the municipality . The municipality , the true owner of the building , had not authorised the purchase of the rooms in the building by their current owners . Accordingly , the sale of the building in the absence of authorisation by the municipality meant that the municipality had lost possession against its will , and could recover its property from bona fide purchasers .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment of DATE on appeal .
CARDINAL . The applicants in the present application , Mr PERSON and PERSON , were minors at the relevant time .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , acting on their behalf , the ORG mother sued PERSON ( the person who had sold the rooms to the applicants ) for damages .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG of PERSON granted her claims and awarded damages in the amount of MONEY ( RUB ) to each of the applicants . On DATE and CARDINAL July CARDINAL ORG upheld the above - mentioned judgments on appeal .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date a bailiff initiated enforcement proceedings . On DATE he discontinued the enforcement proceedings , noting that it was impossible to establish PERSON whereabouts or identify his assets , if any such assets existed .
CARDINAL . It appears that the enforcement proceedings in respect of the judgment of DATE are still pending .
